definition: everything is fine except for one small defect (idiom); the fly in the ointment
the Americas/abbr. for 美洲[Mei3 zhou1]/USA/abbr. for 美國|美国[Mei3 guo2]
beautiful/very satisfactory/good/to beautify/to be pleased with oneself
to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)

sentences.english: Amid all the pomp and celebration, one of the darker aspects to the wedding was how thin she was too.
sentences.chinese: 围绕着盛况和庆典，美中不足的一点是，新娘太瘦了。

sentences.english: The weakness is that it takes its crusading a little far.
sentences.chinese: 而美中不足的是在进行讨伐鞭挞的时候走的有点远了。

sentences.english: The ointment contains polymixin B and oxytetracycline in a petroleum base.
sentences.chinese: 美中不足包含在一个多粘菌素B和石油基地土霉素。

sentences.english: The biggest lie is the lie of your imperfection.
sentences.chinese: 最大的谎言是你美中不足的谎言。

sentences.english: Flickit is an upload-only utility. So you're not going to be browsing your photos from it.
sentences.chinese: 美中不足的是该软件只支持上传功能，无法浏览照片。

sentences.english: The only fly in the ointment could be the weather.
sentences.chinese: 唯一美中不足的是天气。

sentences.english: They can show some rough edges and be more appealing for it.
sentences.chinese: 他们能展现一些美中不足之处，并且因此更吸引人。

sentences.english: It didn't take long before we discovered a fly in the ointment, however.
sentences.chinese: 然而，不久我们就发现了美中不足的地方。

sentences.english: The downside of the design is, of course, its lack of visual appeal.
sentences.chinese: 当然，这样设计美中不足的是缺少视觉吸引力。

sentences.english: There isn't enough space for the equipment in the laboratory.
sentences.chinese: 这汤美中不足的是不够咸。

sentences.english: I like the house, but there’s a fly in the ointment: I have to commute so far to work.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢那套房子，但美中不足的是离上班的地方太远。

sentences.english: The introduction of the small fang, but very fluent in the ointment, give a person the feeling of reciting.
sentences.chinese: 小芳的介绍极流利，但美中不足的是给人背诵的感觉。

definition: conforming with the norms of society
it is a pity/what a pity/unfortunately
lit. a blemish does not obscure jade's luster/the pros outweigh the cons (idiom)
only/merely/no more than/but/however/anyway (to get back to a previous topic)/cannot be more (after adjectival)
a faulty stroke in calligraphy or painting/a faulty expression in writing
